abstract.p: Quick Escapes column on visiting Chicago and Las Vegas next weekend (M)

block.p: Chicago
WHEN Oct. 29-31

WHY Next weekend, the Terra Museum of American Art closes permanently. (The foundation that runs it will continue to lend pieces to other museums.) The final exhibitions are ''A Narrative of American Art'' -- a look at 200 years of American art, with works by Mary Cassatt, John Singleton Copley and Winslow Homer -- and ''Chicago Modern, 1893-1945: Pursuit of the New.'' Suggested donation: $5; information: www.terramuseum.org.
(Below are travel and hotel deals that were available yesterday. Air fares were found at www.travelocity.com. Hotel rates, available through www.expedia.com, are for double occupancy.)
GETTING THERE From New York: $210 (ATA). From Miami: $203 (United). From San Francisco: $201 (ATA). From Dallas: $211 (ATA).
WHERE TO STAY Fairmont, $119, (312) 565-8000. Talbott Hotel, $169, (312) 944-4970.
Las Vegas
WHEN Oct. 29-31

WHY The Professional Bull Riders World Finals ends next weekend at the Thomas and Mack Arena. Tickets start at $45 from (866) 727-7469 or www.unlvtickets.com. The weekend also includes a ''cowboy church'' service, a silent auction and a barbecue cook-off. Information: www.pbrworldfinals.com.
GETTING THERE From New York: $251 (Northwest). From Detroit: $255 (America West). From Kansas City: $248 (Northwest). From New Orleans: $279 (American).
WHERE TO STAY MGM Grand, $221, (702) 891-1111. Venetian, $259, (702) 414-4100.
J. R. ROMANKO
